alert.note: Alert for Decatur; Seminole (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 17 at 6:00PM EDT until April 17 at 6:30PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tallahassee has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southeastern Jackson County in the Panhandle of Florida... Northeastern Calhoun County in the Panhandle of Florida... Western Gadsden County in Big Bend of Florida... North central Liberty County in Big Bend of Florida... Southwestern Decatur County in southwestern Georgia... South central Seminole County in southwestern Georgia... * Until 630 PM EDT/530 PM CDT/. * At 600 PM EDT/500 PM CDT/, a severe thunderstorm was located 8 miles west of Chattahoochee, or 16 miles east of Marianna, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Quincy, Greensboro, Chattahoochee, Sneads, Gretna, Grand Ridge, Rock Bluff, Ocheesee, Juniper, Douglas City, Rosedale, Santa Clara, Jinks, Quincy Airport, Wetumpka, Sawdust, Mount Pleasant, Hardin Heights, Hardaway and Sycamore. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will send your report to the National Weather Service office in Tallahassee.
